intro: Alyssoides sinuatum, commonly known as the Sinuous Alyssum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other mustard family plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters, typically in shades of white and purple. It has small, linear leaves and thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. Alyssoides sinuatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
